name: Keye
headline: The Smartest Private Equity Investor
description:
Keye is an AI software that lets private equity firms do due diligence for acquisitions faster and more accurately. Our customers can evaluate 10x more deals and fund better companies which leads directly to better returns/more alpha.
--

Our system is the first of its kind to instantly generate complex, comprehensive data packs from raw data in any format, directly from the data room. This enables investors to gain an 80% understanding of a potential deal within moments, empowering them to say No to a deal earlier in the process and focus on high-potential opportunities. Traditionally, creating these detailed data packs—like cohort or retention analyses and customer roll-forwards—takes weeks, during which critical details may be overlooked, potentially costing funds millions in missed insights and poor decisions.
--

Keye combines cutting-edge AI with deep private equity expertise to deliver powerful, multi-layered insights that go far beyond the simple summarizers and search functions offered by other tools. Our platform dives deep into both quantitative and qualitative due diligence data, offering high-impact analytics crafted specifically for private equity workflows. This isn’t just automation—it’s a purpose-built solution that uncovers actionable insights, fueling smarter decisions and driving true alpha.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:finance; industry:investing; industry:enterprise-software; industry:ai; location:new-york

founders.name: Rohan Parikh, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder & CEO at Keye, Rohan has over 6+ yrs in investment banking, spanning front-office roles across IB and Global Markets. Within 5 years, he was promoted to Director, where he drove a 7x increase in deal flow and revenue. Previously, he worked as a management consultant with Accenture before transitioning to Standard & Poor’s credit division in finance. Rohan holds an MBA from Wharton, complemented by a technical background with a Master's in Financial Engg. & B.Eng degree

founders.name: Conor Brown, Founder
founders.description: Conor is a Co-Founder and the Chief Operating Officer of Keye. Before co-founding Keye, Conor co-founded SecureFlow, a funds flow and deal insights platform for M&A, while earning an MBA from The Wharton School. He has also held key roles as an investor at Vista Equity Partners and an investment banker at Goldman Sachs. He attended Amherst College for his BA, where he also captained the hockey team.

founders.name: Lalit Lal, Cofounder, CTO
founders.description: Lalit is a Cofounder and CTO at Keye. By trade, Lalit is a seasoned software engineer with a over 7 years in industry experience leading and building SaaS products from the ground up. Working through 2 historical SaaS acquisitions as an early engineer and leading technical teams of various sizes, Lalit is comfortable across the stack (devops, frontend, backend, and ML). He comes from a background in Robotics (University of Waterloo) and Machine Learning (University of Toronto).

generated_description:
### Keye: Revolutionizing Due Diligence for Private Equity

**Mission**: Keye aims to be "The Smartest Private Equity Investor" by transforming how private equity firms conduct due diligence. 

**Founded**: This innovative company was established in 2024 and is part of Y Combinator Batch F24. Based in New York, Keye currently has a lean team of just three employees, guided by Group Partner Garry Tan.

**What They Do**: Keye started as an AI software solution for private equity firms, enabling them to evaluate acquisitions with unprecedented speed and accuracy. Their platform empowers users to assess ten times more deals, leading to better investment decisions and enhanced returns—essentially more alpha.

**Unique Offering**: Keye is pioneering a due diligence platform that can instantly generate complex data packs from any format of raw data supplied in a data room. Investors can gain an 80% comprehension of a potential deal within moments, allowing them to reject subpar opportunities quickly and focus on the most promising ones. The traditional process for producing these intricate reports can take weeks, causing critical details to slip through the cracks, often leading to significant financial repercussions.

**How It Works**: Keye combines advanced AI technology with extensive private equity expertise to deliver insights that surpass basic summarization tools. Their platform dives into both quantitative and qualitative analyses, generating actionable insights that enhance decision-making processes. This isn’t just automation; it’s a tailored solution specifically designed to uncover vital insights intrinsic to private equity workflows.

**Key Features**:
- **Quick Analysis**: Parse through large files instantly to extract key information.
- **Data Organization**: Generate organized data packs in seconds, highlighting crucial risks and opportunities.
- **Insight Generation**: Create customized analyses and track historical performance comparisons seamlessly.
- **Confident Auditing**: Conduct data evaluations with pinpoint accuracy and easily export findings.

**Technical Edge**: Keye boasts a sophisticated AI backend that leverages over 10,000 proprietary embeddings tailored to reshape content from private equity documents, alongside 30 years of cumulative experience in finance and technology among its founders. With access to over 1,000 deal documents, the platform is trained to identify insightful anomalies and patterns in data.

**User Base**: Keye has already garnered attention from around 25,000 users at investment firms and corporations keen on enhancing their due diligence processes using the platform’s innovative capabilities.

### Why It Matters

Private equity is a highly competitive space where the difference between winning and losing can hinge on the smallest insights. By providing tools that refine and expedite due diligence, Keye is positioning itself as a vital ally for investment professionals. The ability to efficiently analyze massive datasets not only saves time but also enhances the likelihood of successful investments. In a world fueled by data, having the right tools to leverage that data could well be the key to navigating the complexities of private equity.

For more information, check out their website at [Keye](https://www.keye.co).
